original_text:
Associate Product Manager
not open to c2c, vendors, or 3rd parties 
 
 associate digital product manager 
 
 contract length : 12 months 
 location: only open to candidates currently living in the orlando area. 
 pay range : $55-60/hr. 
 
 the associate product manager will be part of a group that is responsible for the end-to-end digital and physical guest and cast experience for all technology & digital-led initiatives across the attractions & entertainment, food & beverage, resorts & transportation, photopass and merchandise lines of business. 
 
 basic qualifications digital website product experience includes conducting user gap assessment & ideation, writing detailed requirements & acceptance criteria and driving go-to-market delivery efforts.
 experience working with content management systems (cms) and building complex websites, including daily updating of copy and images for sites, feature listings, faceted listings, feeds from other systems, building out new pages and troubleshooting.
 ability to think strategically and drive ideas into action with a willingness to take personal initiative.
 ability to work within a diverse team of resources from strategy, creative, business, and technical disciplines.
 demonstrable ability to collaborate with and achieve results through others, plus the ability to build strong, balanced relationships within all levels of the organization.
 experience resolving technical, user and business issues in a fast-paced online organization.
 experience managing requests that include integration with multiple back-end systems.
 strong analytical and quantitative skills with an ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop project cases.
 experience estimating project costs and level of effort required for delivery.
 outstanding verbal and written communication and project leadership skills, including an ability to communicate and influence at an executive level
 
 key success skills & capabilities 
 
experienced in myjira application, including ticket writing, tracking & reporting
experienced in agile processes, incl. scrum ceremonies (participating & leading)
certified scrum product owner (cspo) certification (preferred)
adept in collaborating on & driving digital product solutions with partners, from ideation through requirements & delivery
experienced in writing detailed, logical & digestible digital product requirements and acceptance criteria
strong cms experience (gopub & aem preferred), from simple content updates (copy/imagery) to advanced website page implementations
demonstrated ability to quickly build trust & meaningful relationships, incl. internally (core team) and externally (business partners/clients)
high attention to detail & passion for excellence in work product delivery
self-starter with proactive drive and a natural sense of urgency
evidences genuine empathy toward the guest/consumer and a commitment to thoroughly explore opportunities and drive solutions
fastidious in having a raise the bar mentality to constructively challenge both internal team & partner thinking/requests
strong communication skills with a demonstrated ability to engage and lead in-person & virtual meetings
 
 education 
 
ba/bs or equivalent experience
 
 compensation: 
the estimated pay range for this position is $55.00/hr. - $60.00/hr. and is an exempt role.
exact compensation and offers of employment are dependent on circumstances of each case and will be determined based on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, licenses or certifications, and location.
 
 benefits: 
we offer comprehensive benefit options which vary depending on role, location, and employment type. the talent acquisition partner can share more details about compensation or benefits for the specific role during the hiring process.

Bilingual Project Manager / Scrum Master
sensiple inc., service offerings include contingent staff augmentation of it professionals, permanent recruiting and temp-to-hire. in addition, our industry expertise and knowledge within financial services, insurance, telecom, manufacturing, technology, media, and entertainment, pharmaceutical, health care and service industries ensures our services are customized to meet specific needs. for more details, please visit our website: 
we have been retained for providing recruiting assistance, for direct hires, by one of the world-leading information technology consulting, services, and business process outsourcing organization that envisioned and pioneered the adoption of the flexible global business practices that today enable companies to operate more efficiently and produce more value.
 
sensiple, inc. is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, veteran or disability status.
 
our client is looking for a bilingual project manager / scrum master at plano, tx (locals preferred). this is a 12 plus months’ contract role. please find below the details of the position.
 
job description
position title: bilingual project manager / scrum master
location: plano, tx
length: long term contract
 
job description:
this candidate will provide project management (pm) and scrum master (sm) support for the remote embedded and cabin awareness engineering teams. this position requires a good mix of pm skills to support the project team deliverables for each team as well as sm skills to be able to help these teams organize and prioritize their day-to-day work for each sprint in order to deliver committed work to senior management and the organization.
this candidate must be bilingual in english and japanese as these teams have significant impact and therefore are needed in off-hour meetings and many interfaces required with teams based in japan. 
essential functions:
	act on behalf of the supported teams to remove impediments and obstacles for the teams and to produce an environment that helps the team(s) deliver their products and meet milestones.
	work along with the lead product owner in managing backlog and its prioritization.
	support project/program activities and ensuring the timely deliveries of the deliverables.
	manage issues/risks/dependencies and status reporting to the stakeholders.
	ensure agile methodology i.e., scrum, kanban, is understood and leveraged to ensure the supported teams are maximizing their efficiency.
	as scrum master, facilitate agile events and work with team members to participate and own their role within the scrum team to deliver consistent and quality results.
 
minimum qualifications:
	fluent in english and japanese
	a good mix of people management, analytical, and organizational skills are a must have.
	in-depth knowledge of software development lifecycle
	experience in behavior driven development, test driven development, or specification by example.
	tools: ms office, atlassian jira/confluence, lucid spark, power bi, tableau
	committed to continuous learning, and able to demonstrate a pattern of personal development in automobile domain knowledge and pm/sm processes.
	required in off-hour meetings and interfaces with offshore (japan) teams.
 
preferred qualifications:
	adobe experience is a plus.
 
if you find yourself suitable for this position, kindly send your updated resume and expected hourly rate to  or reach us @ ext 509
 
 
regards
sharumathi | sensiple inc.,
 ext (509)
555 us highway 1 s, ste 330 iselin, nj 08830

original_text:
Data Architect
role: data architect
location: hybrid 2 days/week in dallas, tx specifically on tuesday and wednesday
duration: fulltime
 
notes:
	looking for someone very hands on, who can create framework for the team to follow.
	this person will be a part of the data lake project
	*big data experience*
	need: architecture; big data platform experience, prior traditional experience with warehouse & ods warehouse experience
	azure technology, data bricks is a must with python.
	data ingestion, transformation, data modeling, data platform (given)
	12+, 15-20 years is ideal.
	new project – enterprise help from this project
	team size – 30 people including data engineers & product engineers, architecture team; in dallas, california, china, and india
	strong python, spark, data bricks, data governance
	speaking to stakeholder
 
responsibilities:
	be able to architect, design and develop data models (actual models, ddls and as required be able to create physical structures of those models).
	have a hands-on approach to solving problems; when required, be able to lead-by-example-type of person in developing snippets of the sqls, any code references that team can use and follow.
	have deep knowledge of data architectures, ods, data warehouse and methodologies.
	good working knowledge of data models and be able to use any industry leading data modeling tools to create data models and update them as needed.
	maps the systems and interfaces used to manage data sets, set standards for data management
	analyzes current state and conceives desired future state; and conceives projects needed to close the gap between current and future goals with new data technologies and industry trends.
	ability to astutely operate in the organization, and being able to emphasize methodology, modelling and governance.
	ability to work closely with the users, systems designers and the developers on a project both in agile & sdlc methodology
	need to be able to have an end-to-end vision, and to see how a logical design will translate into one or more physical databases, and how the data will flow through the successive stages involved.
	the data architect will need to be able to address issues of data migration (validation, clean-up and mapping), and understanding the importance of data dictionaries
	coordinate with business partners, technical analysts and developers to identify and define specifications, indicate areas of system impact and continuously communicate project status and needs.
	manages change control processes, and ensures program/project communications.
	negotiates project plans, time frames, and trade-off with business partners, and apprises management of impact to project.
	strong leadership, communications and presentation skills with the ability to clearly communicate status to senior management team.
	mentor, provide guidance, advice, and support to team members.
	other duties as assigned.
 
requirements:
	12+ years of experience as a data architect, developer, data warehouse developer and / or data related operations.
	graduation from a 4-year college or university with major course work in a discipline related to the requirements of the position is preferred. will consider the equivalent combination of job experience & education that demonstrates the ability to perform the essential functions of this job. high school diploma or state accepted equivalency required.
	5+ years of industry experience working with big data platforms architecture, scalability and performance.
	5+ progressive years of experience with design/architecture for transformations and modernizations of enterprise data & storage solutions using azure cloud technologies.
	deep expertise in real-time and batch data processing at large scale
	experience with databricks design, development, administration, implementations, and operations.
	experience with data movement and transformation capabilities (azure data factory, data lake analytics, databricks, stream analytics, and azure functions).
	strong development background creating data pipelines and complex data transformations using one of the languages like python, databricks/spark, t-sql.
	5+ progressive years of experience in data warehouse and business intelligence technologies including data modeling techniques (logical & physical)
	experience with visualization tools such as ssrs, tableau, microsoft power bi.
	demonstrated experience in creating data governance strategies including mdm and data quality tools & processes.
	well versed in sdlc, devops, and ci/cd deployment pipelines
	strong track record of interviewing business partners, setting and managing expectations in relation to deliverables and requirements.
	excellent problem-solving skills and analytical skills.
	excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to establish deep understanding of clients' business issues.
	mortgage and/or financial industry knowledge is strongly preferred.
